meanings.definition: Tube through which an egg passes from an ovary to the uterus or to the outside of the body.
meanings.sent1: The oviducts in the hen's body help transport eggs from the ovaries to the outside.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the oviducts to understand how eggs move from the ovaries to the uterus.
meanings.sent3: The oviducts decided to take a break from their egg-carrying duties and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her oviducts were like a busy highway, constantly moving eggs from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The intricate network of oviducts in the female body ensures the safe passage of eggs.

meanings.definition: A duct through which eggs pass from the ovaries to the outside of the body.
meanings.sent1: The tiny oviducts in the female reproductive system play a crucial role in egg transportation.
meanings.sent2: Eggs travel through the oviducts before being released from the body.
meanings.sent3: The oviducts threw a party to celebrate successfully guiding the eggs out of the body.
meanings.sent4: His oviducts were like a well-oiled machine, smoothly directing eggs to their destination.
meanings.sent5: The oviducts, like diligent workers, ensure the eggs reach their destination without any delays.
